moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Bf5 5. Ng3 Bg6 6. h4 h6 7. Nf3 Nf6 8. Ne5 Bh7 9. Bd3 Bxd3 10. Qxd3 e6 11. Bf4 Qa5+ 12. c3 Qa6 13. Ne4
comment: This seems to be a novelty.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Bf5 5. Ng3 Bg6 6. h4 h6 7. Nf3 Nf6 8. Ne5 Bh7 9. Bd3 Bxd3 10. Qxd3 e6 11. Bf4 Qa5+ 12. c3 Qa6 13. Ne4 Nxe4 14. Qxe4 Nd7 15. Nxd7 Kxd7
comment:
White has more space for manoeuvring, which defines his
advantage. Ponomariov gives a good example how to handle such positions:

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Bf5 5. Ng3 Bg6 6. h4 h6 7. Nf3 Nf6 8. Ne5 Bh7 9. Bd3 Bxd3 10. Qxd3 e6 11. Bf4 Qa5+ 12. c3 Qa6 13. Ne4 Nxe4 14. Qxe4 Nd7 15. Nxd7 Kxd7 16. Rh3 Rc8 17. Be5 Qc4 18. Rf3 f6 19. Bg3 f5 20. Qc2 g5
comment: perhaps better was to play ...Re8 and evacuate the king to c8.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Bf5 5. Ng3 Bg6 6. h4 h6 7. Nf3 Nf6 8. Ne5 Bh7 9. Bd3 Bxd3 10. Qxd3 e6 11. Bf4 Qa5+ 12. c3 Qa6 13. Ne4 Nxe4 14. Qxe4 Nd7 15. Nxd7 Kxd7 16. Rh3 Rc8 17. Be5 Qc4 18. Rf3 f6 19. Bg3 f5 20. Qc2 g5 21. Be5 Rg8 22. b3 Qd5 23. c4 Qa5+ 24. Kf1 Be7 25. hxg5 Rxg5 26. Rd1 h5 27. Qe2 Qa6 28. Bf4
comment:
The bishop only LOOKED good onn e5, but it lacked any useful
role. Relocating this piece White prepares to put pressure on the e6-pawn.
Black position is already very difficult.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Bf5 5. Ng3 Bg6 6. h4 h6 7. Nf3 Nf6 8. Ne5 Bh7 9. Bd3 Bxd3 10. Qxd3 e6 11. Bf4 Qa5+ 12. c3 Qa6 13. Ne4 Nxe4 14. Qxe4 Nd7 15. Nxd7 Kxd7 16. Rh3 Rc8 17. Be5 Qc4 18. Rf3 f6 19. Bg3 f5 20. Qc2 g5 21. Be5 Rg8 22. b3 Qd5 23. c4 Qa5+ 24. Kf1 Be7 25. hxg5 Rxg5 26. Rd1 h5 27. Qe2 Qa6 28. Bf4 Rg6 29. Re3 Rcg8 30. g3 h4 31. Re1
comment:
Black's position is cracking, as he cannot hold the e6-pawn. He must
defend tactically, but this already does not help:

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Bf5 5. Ng3 Bg6 6. h4 h6 7. Nf3 Nf6 8. Ne5 Bh7 9. Bd3 Bxd3 10. Qxd3 e6 11. Bf4 Qa5+ 12. c3 Qa6 13. Ne4 Nxe4 14. Qxe4 Nd7 15. Nxd7 Kxd7 16. Rh3 Rc8 17.
